flawed_nl_solution:
If each lap is 400 meters long, then 3 laps will have a total distance of 400*3 = <<400*3=12000>>12000 meters
The total time he ran was 70 on the first lap + 85 on the second one and 85 on the third lap, so his total running time was = 70+85+85 = <<70+85+85=240>>240 seconds
His average speed then is measured by the total distance he ran (12000) divided by the total time required (240) or 12000/240 = <<12000/240=50>>50 m/s
#### 50

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1200, not 12000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
